verses.verse: (PSALM 56) (Pleading for Help and Grateful Trust in God.) (For the music director; according to Jonath elem rehokim. A Mikhtam of David, when the Philistines seized him in Gath.) (Or The silent dove of those who are far off; or The dove of the distant terebinths) (Possibly Epigrammatic Poem; or Atonement Psalm) (1 Sam 21:10, 11) Be gracious to me, God, for a man has (Or snapped at) trampled upon me; (Or A fighting man) Fighting all day long he oppresses me.
My enemies have trampled upon me all day long, For (Or many are fighting) they are many who fight proudly against me.
(Lit The day) When I am afraid, (Or I am one who puts) I will put my trust in You.
In God, whose word I praise, In God I have put my trust; I shall not be afraid. What can mere (Lit flesh) mortals do to me?
All day long they distort my words; All their (Or purposes) thoughts are against me for evil.
They (Or stir up strife) attack, they lurk, They watch my (Lit heels) steps, As they have waited to take my (Lit soul) life.
Because of their wickedness, will there be an escape for them? In anger make the peoples fall down, God!
You have taken account of my (Or wanderings) miseries; Put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not in Your book?
Then my enemies will turn back on the day when I call; This I know, (Or because) that God is for me.
In God, whose word I praise, In the LORD, whose word I praise,
In God I have put my (Or trust without fear) trust, I shall not be afraid. What can mankind do to me?
Your vows are binding upon me, God; I will render thanksgiving offerings to You.
For You have saved my soul from death, (Or Have You not delivered) Indeed my feet from stumbling, So that I may walk before God In the light of the (Or life) living.
